element.name: TechnicalRequirements
element.desc: Applications, OS, and network requirements for activity if applicable.

element.name: EssentialMaterials
element.desc: Essential materials required to engage in this activity.

element.name: Title
element.desc: Descriptive name of the activity.

element.name: Preamble
element.desc: Description and context for the activity.

element.name: LearningObjectives
element.desc: Description of the educational objective of the activity.

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: Link from activity to associated LearningStandardItem objects.

element.name: Prerequisites
element.desc: Skills or competencies the student must have to engage in activity.

element.name: Students
element.desc: Link to any student or group or category of students that this activity is for.

element.name: Points
element.desc: Number of possible points for an activity.

element.name: AssessmentRefId
element.desc: Link to the SIF Assessment object containing the evaluation information for this activity.

element.name: MaxAttemptsAllowed
element.desc: How many tries allowed.

element.name: ActivityWeight
element.desc: The percentage weight of the activity during the particular course or term.

element.name: LearningResources
element.desc: A GUID reference to a SIF LearningResource object that support this activity

element.name: SoftwareRequirementList
element.desc: Contains information about required software.

element.name: CreationDate
element.desc: Creation date of the activity.

element.name: Duration
element.desc: Time required to complete the activity.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Date activity is started.

element.name: FinishDate
element.desc: Date activity is finished.

element.name: DueDate
element.desc: Date activity is due.

element.name: AlternateIdentificationCode
element.desc: An alphanumeric ID code as defined by the organization to identify the statement.

element.name: Organization
element.desc: Name of agency that approved use of resource.

element.name: Date
element.desc: Date resource was approved.

element.name: Students
element.desc: GUID assigned to the student or students given this assignment.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the educator who gave the assignment.

element.name: TechnicalRequirements
element.desc: Applications, OS, and network requirements for activity if applicable.

element.name: EssentialMaterials
element.desc: Essential materials required to engage in the assignment.

element.name: Title
element.desc: Descriptive name of the assignment.

element.name: Preamble
element.desc: Description and context for the assignment.

element.name: LearningObjectives
element.desc: Description of the educational objectives of the assignment.

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: Link from assignment to associated LearningStandardItem objects.

element.name: Prerequisites
element.desc: Skills or competencies the student must have to engage in assignment.

element.name: MaxAttemptsAllowed
element.desc: The number attempts a student may make on this assignment. Assumed to be unlimited if omitted.

element.name: AddToGradeBookFlag
element.desc: Flag to prompt grade book processing.

element.name: SoftwareRequirementList
element.desc: Contains information about required software.

element.name: CreationDate
element.desc: Creation date of the assignment

element.name: Duration
element.desc: Time required to complete the assignment.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Date assignment is started.

element.name: StartTime
element.desc: Time assignment is started.

element.name: DueDate
element.desc: Date assignment is due.

element.name: DueTime
element.desc: Time assignment is due.

element.name: AdministrationDate
element.desc: Date that the assignment was administered to student if an assessment.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: Attribute that identifies the type of SIF object being referenced.

element.name: Author
element.desc: Name of the organization that authored the standards document, i.e. "Mid-Continent Research for Education & Learning (McREL)." May be the same as "Organization" above.

element.name: Document
element.desc: A curriculum standards document or the like published by a national, state, district, school site, professional association or other interested party.

object.name: CatalogLearningStandardsDocument
object.desc: A curriculum standards document or the like published by a national, state, district, school site, professional association or other interested party.

element.name: Title
element.desc: Name of the standard document, e.g., "Washington Essential Academic Learning Requirements."

element.name: StandardsSettingBody
element.desc: The name of the state or organization that authored and manages updates to the standards document (e.g., NCTM, Ohio Department of Education).

object.name: Component
object.desc: A lesson or activity-sized portion of a resource.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of learning resource component within the resource, i.e. "Chapter 1, Section 4.

element.name: Reference
element.desc: Description of where ResourceComponent is located within resource or in general, i.e. "Section 4, pages 32-38," or URL string, or whatever locator is appropriate for media.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of ResourceComponent, i.e. "Discover how changing the scale of a map can either increase or decrease the level of detail you see."

element.name: Strategies
element.desc: Teaching/learning strategies uses in the learning resource. One per element.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: The type of learning object being referenced.

object.name: ContentCatalog
object.desc: This object contains information related to learning resources that can be searched for and retrieved from content repositories.

attribute.name: Language
attribute.desc: The default language used in this ContentCatalog object.

element.name: ContentObject
element.desc: The learning object.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Describes availability status of resource, e.g. "checked out."

element.name: Title
element.desc: Title of the resource, e.g., "The Civil War …"

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of the resource, e.g., "This textbook is intended for grade 4 social studies students and addresses..."

element.name: Author
element.desc: Name of individual, organization or company that created the resource

element.name: LanguageCode
element.desc: The language used by the content to communicate to the Student

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: A common element used to specify the collection of grade levels supported.

element.name: SubjectAreas
element.desc: A list of subject areas.

element.name: MediaTypes
element.desc: Resource media types

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: This element contains information related to curriculum standards statements "standards" or "benchmarks" or the like within the document.

element.name: InstructionalLevel
element.desc: An indication of the general nature and difficulty of instruction provided.

element.name: TechnicalRequirements
element.desc: Operating system, network, and other technical requirements for the activity, if applicable.

element.name: Duration
element.desc: Time required to complete the activity.

element.name: Prerequisites
element.desc: Skills or competencies the student must have to engage in activity.

element.name: Adaptations
element.desc: Adaptations necessary for target students (508)

element.name: Size
element.desc: The size of the learning content objects.

element.name: Cost
element.desc: The price of the object requested

attribute.name: ReferenceType
attribute.desc: A qualifying attribute for the Location payload. If ReferenceType is "URI", the payload contains a web address where the resource can be found.

element.name: SourceObject
element.desc: GUID assigned to the source object.

element.name: Location
element.desc: Description of location of resource, i.e. location in library or URL, community resource, outside resource supplier.

element.name: Date
element.desc: Copyright date

element.name: Holder
element.desc: Name of the copyright holder

object.name: CurriculumHierarchy
object.desc: Description of additional curriculum hierarchical level

element.name: Level
element.desc: Number reference of Curriculum Hierarchy

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of Curriculum Hierarchy level

element.name: ParentLevel
element.desc: Parent Level

element.name: Number
element.desc: Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within the CurriculumStructure tree. The top level is 1.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Used to describe what role this is serving in the structure. Some curriculum objects describe their levels in terms of programs of study, courses and units. Others use other terms. This attribute names the level of the item.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Used to describe what role this is serving in the structure. Some curriculum objects describe their levels in terms of programs of study, courses and units. Others use other terms.

element.name: CurriculumHierarchy
element.desc: Description of additional curriculum hierarchical level

element.name: Titles
element.desc: Name of this type of curriculum object (e.g., "American Revolutionary War")

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of this curriculum object

element.name: CurriculumHierarchyLevel
element.desc: Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within the CurriculumStructure tree. The top level is "1".

element.name: PredecessorObjects
element.desc: GUID assigned to the CurriculumStructure object directly above it in the hierarchy tree. This is repeatable because a single object can have multiple parent levels of the hierarchy. It is null if there is no parent object.

element.name: LearningObjectives
element.desc: Narrative description of learning objective(s) for the CurriculumStructure object.

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: Associated learning standards.

element.name: CurriculumStructureRefId
element.desc: A GUID reference to the parent CurriculumStructure object of this Lesson.

element.name: EssentialMaterial
element.desc: Essential material required to engage in this activity.

object.name: Evaluation
object.desc: Field for non-numeric types of grading and evaluation such as "narrative."

attribute.name: EvaluationType
attribute.desc: A qualifer for what type of evaluation this is. Valid values are "Inline" and "RefId". Inline values are contained in the optional Description element, RefIds are contained in the AssessmentRefId element.

element.name: Description
element.desc: A free text description of the evaluation to be used for this activity

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of learning resource.

element.name: Author
element.desc: Name of organization or company that created the resource.

element.name: Location
element.desc: Description of location of resource, i.e. location in library or URL, community resource, outside resource supplier.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Describes availability status of resource, e.g. "checked out."

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of the resource, e.g., "This textbook is intended for grade 4 social studies students and addresses..."

element.name: MediaTypes
element.desc: MIME types [MIME] based on IANA registration (see RFC2048) or 'non-digital'.

element.name: UseAgreement
element.desc: Describes terms of use for resource.

element.name: AgreementDate
element.desc: A date that defines the date of agreement.

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: Reference to a LearningStandardItem.

element.name: LearningResourcePackageRefId
element.desc: Reference to a LearningResourcePackage, a transport envelope for teaching and learning object files.

object.name: LearningResourcePackage
object.desc: A wrapper for any external learning content to be transmitted across a SIF Zone.

element.name: TextData
element.desc: Contains arbitrary text, encoded in UTF-8.

element.name: BinaryData
element.desc: Contains the base64Binary encoding of binary or text data not encoded in UTF-8.

element.name: LearningResourceRefId
element.desc: Link to an aligned LearningResource object.

element.name: Title
element.desc: Name of standard document, i.e., "Washington Essential Academic Learning Requirements."

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of the standards document.

element.name: Source
element.desc: Defines source of standard document. This is the descriptive type of the organization listed in Organization. It serves to describe the type of the standards contained within the document.

element.name: Organizations
element.desc: Name of organization represented by the document, i.e., "National Council of Teachers of Mathematics (NCTM)," "Washington," "Seattle School District."

element.name: Authors
element.desc: Name of the organization that authored the standards document, i.e. "Mid-Continent Research for Education & Learning (McREL)." May be the same as "Organization" above.

element.name: OrganizationContactPoint
element.desc: A brief description of how to contact the organization maintaining the standards. It could be a phone number, email address, or URL.

element.name: DocumentDate
element.desc: The date the current status was achieved.

element.name: LocalAdoptionDate
element.desc: The date the local organization adopted this standard document

element.name: LocalArchiveDate
element.desc: The date the local organization stopped using this standard document and superseded by a new document.

element.name: EndOfLifeDate
element.desc: This is the date that the governing organization retired this document.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: SIF common GradeLevels element

element.name: RepositoryDate
element.desc: Date document data was added to the repository

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: Link to the first/top LearningStandardItem in the Standard hierarchy

element.name: RelatedLearningStandards
element.desc: Links to related LearningStandardDocument

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID assigned to each statement at each level within the document hierarchy

element.name: StandardHierarchyLevel
element.desc: Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within standards tree. The top level is "1".

element.name: PredecessorItems
element.desc: GUID assigned to the LearningStandardItem directly above it in the hierarchy tree. This is a repeatable element because a single granular item may relate to multiple parent levels of the hierarchy.

element.name: StatementCodes
element.desc: An alphanumeric ID code as defined by the organization to identify the statement.

element.name: Statements
element.desc: The text of the "standard," or "benchmark."

element.name: RelatedLearningStandardItems
element.desc: A relationship between the current standard item and another standard item.

element.name: Level4
element.desc: This is the second to most granular level of the learning or performance standard associated with the grade level.

element.name: Level5
element.desc: This is the most granular level of the learning or performance standard associated with the grade level.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: GUID of an associated LearningStandardItem object

element.name: SourceObjects
element.desc: Reference to the source object.

element.name: CurriculumStructures
element.desc: A GUID reference to the parent CurriculumStructure object of this Lesson.

element.name: Title
element.desc: Name of lesson.

element.name: Duration
element.desc: Desired duration of the lesson

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of the lesson plan.

element.name: Procedure
element.desc: Text field to describe how to use and implement the lesson.

element.name: Strategies
element.desc: Teaching strategy used in this lesson plan.

element.name: LearningObjectives
element.desc: Description of learning objective(s) for this lesson, i.e., "Student will be able to use Pythagorean Theorem."--equates to 'benchmark' or 'goal' or other terminology

element.name: SupportingActivities
element.desc: Links to Activity objects that make support the lesson

element.name: LearningStandards
element.desc: Link to an associated LearningStandardItem. This allows for a single Lesson to be aligned to multiple standard statements.

element.name: LearningResources
element.desc: Link to an aligned LearningResource object.

element.name: Organization
element.desc: Name of organization represented by the document, i.e., "National Council of Teachers of Mathematics (NCTM)," "Washington," "Seattle School District."

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the LearningStandardItem directly above it in the hierarchy tree. This is a repeatable element because a single granular item may relate to multiple parent levels of the hierarchy.

element.name: CurriculumStructureRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the CurriculumStructure object directly above it in the hierarchy tree.

element.name: Prerequisite
element.desc: Skill or competency the student must have to engage in activity.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: Links to related LearningStandardDocument

element.name: LearningStandardDocumentRefId
element.desc: Links to related LearningStandardDocument

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of contact person. Use the generic element Name.

element.name: Address
element.desc: Address of organization or company.

element.name: PhoneNumber
element.desc: Phone number of organization or company.

element.name: Email
element.desc: The email of the organization or company.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Description of evaluation of resource.

element.name: Date
element.desc: Date evaluation was performed

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of individual who submitted evaluation.

element.name: Evaluation
element.desc: Name of individual who submitted evaluation.

attribute.name: ReferenceType
attribute.desc: A qualifying attribute for the ResourceLocation payload. If ReferenceType is "URI", the payload contains a web address where the resource can be found.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of the author.

element.name: Organization
element.desc: Organization name.

element.name: Address
element.desc: Address of the author.

element.name: Email
element.desc: Email address of the author.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: The type of learning object the source object is.

element.name: Number
element.desc: Integer assigned to each hierarchical level within standards tree. The top level is "1".

element.name: Description
element.desc: Used to describe what role this item is serving in the structure. Some standards describe their levels in terms of standard, strands, and topics. Others use standards, benchmarks, and indicators. This attribute names the level of the item.

element.name: YearCreated
element.desc: This represents the year that this specific learning standard was created. This is important to indicate as standards are updated to reflect the appropriate year it was created. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: SubjectArea
element.desc: This represents the subject or content area this learning standard addresses. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.\

element.name: StandardNumber
element.desc: This is the specific number of the standard. For example, if the subject is mathematics and this standard is Patterns, Functions and Algebra, this would be StandardNumber 1. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: This represents the grade level(s) this specific learning standard will address. This may be addressed in different ways. Some states have a grade level that covers several grades and others have just one grade. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: Benchmark
element.desc: This is the next level within the hierarchy of the learning standard. For example, if the subject is mathematics and the standard is algebra, this would be the next delineation - Represent an unknown quantity as a variable using a symbol, including letters. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: GradeLevel
element.desc: This is the specific grade level. This is to be utilized if the GradeLevel covers several grades. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: IndicatorNumber
element.desc: This would be the most granular level of the learning standard associated with the grade level. Following the same example, an indicator for Algebra GradeLevel 5-7, the indicator for the benchmark above at 6 grade would be to Evaluate simple expressions by replacing variables with given values, and use formulas in problem-solving situations. This would be assigned and unique to the standard setting body.

element.name: Organization
element.desc: Name of organization represented by the document, i.e., "National Council of Teachers of Mathematics (NCTM)," "Washington," "Seattle School District." This is the name of the organization that has this AlternateIdentificationCode. This should be a text field.

element.name: Country
element.desc: The country of the standard setting body.

element.name: StateProvince
element.desc: The state or province of the standard setting body.

element.name: NCESId
element.desc: National Center for Education Statistics Id.

element.name: SettingBodyName
element.desc: This is the text version of the organization's name.

element.name: StatementCode
element.desc: An alphanumeric ID code as defined by the organization to identify the statement.

element.name: Statement
element.desc: The text of the "standard," or "benchmark."

element.name: Strategy
element.desc: Teaching strategy used in this lesson plan.

element.name: ActivityRefId
element.desc: Links to Activity objects that may support the lesson

element.name: TechnicalRequirement
element.desc: Applications, OS, or network requirement for activity.

object.name: Title
object.desc: Name of this type of curriculum object (e.g., "American Revolutionary War")

element.name: Title
element.desc: Name of this type of curriculum object (e.g., "American Revolutionary War")
